channel.title: Context on The Desk Reject
channel.description: Recent content in Context on The Desk Reject

item.title: W.W.P.M.D?
item.description: One of the most contentious issues in recent debates about replication studies concerns the importance of context in explaining failed replications. Those who question the value of direct replication often suggest that many psychological effects should be expected not to replicate because they depend so strongly on a multitude of seemingly inconsequential contextual factors. Thus, because you canâ€™t step in the same river twice, direct replication attempts should often be expected to fail.
